column4: OK, but I'm having trouble file sharing.  Do you think it could be just a bad install?
define file sharing
samba.  I can't mount shared windows folders.
got smbclient installed ?
I dont know.
sudo apt-get install smbclient smbfs
here is the official ubuntu guide https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MountWindowsSharesPermanently
already newest version
I don't want to mount the shares permanently.
then can you just browse them through the file manager under network?
Nope
some problem on the windows side then i'd guess. folders not shared correctly some how.
they share fine if I use windows.  I'm trying to phase windows off my machine.
wait... are the shared folders your trying to access on a windows machine or ?
the SERVER (shared files) are on a windows machine, or the files are on a linux machine your answer is confusing me.
I want access to files/folders on a windows machine.
smbclient -L ip-of-machine
ip of windows machine
i don't know what the ip of your machine is man.
oh, and it has shared docs in there too.
you will need to mount using the link I gave earlier using cifs.
ok
